messages.title: SAME OLD TORIES SAY: "YOU'RE ON YOUR OWN"
messages.content: SCHOOLS, HOSPITALS AND HOMES UNDER THREAT FROM TORY PLANS

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Restore the pensions link with earnings, protect Sure Start, establish a People’s Bank at the Post Office, introduce a fully elected House of Lords, create 400,000 new green jobs by 2015, introduce a global tax on banks.

Stop selling council housing to property speculators, introduce a London living wage, cut Camden's carbon emissions by 40% by 2020, freeze pay for the 26 council staff paid more than 100K, introduce new football pitches for children and teams of community Gardening clubs, build a school south of Euston Road.

issues.economy: The Tories will slash frontline services within 50 days of coming to power, in what David Cameron and George Osborne call ‘do it yourself’ public services.
issues.education: Under Labour the free entitlement will remain free, with no top-up charges for toddlers.
issues.environment: Cut Camden's carbon emissions by 40% by 2020.
issues.governance: Introduce a fully elected House of Lords and hold a referendum on Proportional Representation
issues.socialWelfare: Stop selling council housing to property speculators.

housing.content: Stop selling council housing to property speculators.

quotes.text: "I AM CONSERVATIVE TO THE CORE OF MY BEING, AS THOSE WHO KNOW ME BEST WILL TESTIFY"
Last weekend it was revealed that the Conservative are planning to charge parents for currently free nursery places.

images.caption: SAME OLD TORIES SAY: "YOU'RE ON YOUR OWN"

leaflet.additionalNotes: The Tories would risk the recovery with immediate public spending cuts - just like the 1980s. They would cut Sure Start - at least 3 centres will go in Camden. Tory mayor Boris Johnson is already cutting 500 police.
